text:
Hi everyone, I'm starting to plan work on HubSpot and I'm wondering:
1) is there any way to exclude the tracking/analytics JS from pages created from HubSpot drag-n-drop templates?
2) is there a way to compile and minify all the CSS and all the JS files linked in a drag-n-drop template?
I would feel more comfortable with coded templates but my content editors would love the drag-n-drop page building capabilities :confused:

2) HubSpot does all that for you. it may temporarily show uncompiled after publishing, that’s usually only momentary though and is done while HS’s tools are analyzing if the minfied script causes visual differences.
1) not sure why you would want to exclude the tracking scripts, I don’t think it’s trivial to disable.
